DESPITE ALL THE ODDS.Definition: despite having to deal with a lot of difficulty

DESIRE.Definition: a strong feeling of wanting someone

COTTON.Definition: a soft white substance that grows on a tall plant and is used for clothing

RECOGNISABLE.Definition: easy to recognise, to know who he was

TABLE SAW.Definition: a woodworking tool powered by an electric motor

FOOLING AROUND.Definition: behaving in a silly and funny way

TRIVIA.Definition: small details or not so important information

INTERPRETER.Definition: someone whose job is to translate a type of language into or from another type of communication, like Morse Code

MORSE CODE.Definition: a system of dots and dashes, short and long sounds, or flashes of light, used to represent letters or numbers

CODED.Definition: being in a secret form by using a system of words, letters or signs

CIVILIAN.Definition: normal life of a citizen, not related with the army

DOOR-TO-DOOR SALESMAN.Definition: a person whose job is to sell products going from one house to another

MAKE ENDS MEET.Definition: have enough money to cover the basic needs

BREAK.Definition: an opportunity or chance that would lead to success

ADJUSTED.Definition: changed it to make more suitable

SWAPPED.Definition: exchanged, gave it up for something else

CATAPULTED.Definition: put or sent him in a sudden and quick way

INMATES.Definition: people who were kept in prison

WASHED DOWN.Definition: made easier to swallow with the help of a liquid

UNDERSTATEMENT.Definition: something that describes less than the truth

PASSED OUT.Definition: not awake and aware of his environment, unconscious

PULSE.Definition: the regular beating of the heart

BADLY-KEPT SECRET.Definition: secret that was known to many people

TRAINWRECK.Definition: a chaotic or very problematic situation

INFATUATED.Definition: having very strong feelings of attraction for, completely in love

INSEPARABLE.Definition: spending most of their time together

TRAUMATIC.Definition: causing serious emotional damage and pain

DRUG-ADDLED.Definition: confused or lost due to the use of drugs

ENDANGERED.Definition: at risk of extinction, in danger of not existing

MALFUNCTIONED.Definition: failed to work or operate correctly

COMATOSE.Definition: in a state of coma, senseless

BUZZARDS.Definition: mean and unpleasant persons (literally a type of bird)

JUMPED INTO.Definition: got into in a quick way

NEAR-FATAL.Definition: that almost cost him his life

REINTERPRETED.Definition: changed, saw in a new way

SPIRALLING OUT OF CONTROL.Definition: being in an uncontrollable or chaotic situation

CHAOTIC.Definition: in a state of confusion or disorder
